pr_title: Add Close method for closing OutputStream and PcapWriteHandler

timeline.message: add close method for closing outputstream and pcapwritehandler
Add close flag in PcapWriter and fix timestamp bug

timeline.bodyText: No need to explicitly initialise this to false.
timeline.author: chrisvest

@@ -29,6 +28,11 @@
      */
     private final OutputStream outputStream;

timeline.bodyText: What's the meaning of this comment? The handler is not closed, but we called close on the handler?
timeline.author: chrisvest

replies.bodyText: The close method closes OutputStream and PcapWriter so that, Pcap writes are stopped. The handler is not closed because we want data to still travel across.
replies.author: hyperxpro

timeline.bodyText: Should this method be idempotent, i.e. a no-op when isClosed is already true?
timeline.author: chrisvest

timeline.bodyText: This method should ideally be idempotent, such that closing an already closed PcapWriter does nothing. Relying on the flush call on a closed OutputStream not throwing seems a bit shaky.
timeline.author: chrisvest

timeline.bodyText: Would be better to hoist this condition to the start of the method and return early if the writer is closed, no?
timeline.author: chrisvest
